Web Development Resources

  • #frontend-development,
  • #web-development
Updated on March 2, 2025

Guides

Frontend Developer Roadmap. A structured roadmap outlining key technologies, tools, and concepts for frontend developers at all levels.

Courses

Codecademy. Interactive coding lessons covering frontend and full-stack web development with hands-on projects.

FreeCodeCamp. A free coding curriculum with thousands of exercises, certifications, and real-world projects.

The Odin Project. A full-stack web development course focusing on hands-on learning and building real projects.

Books

Frontend Masters Frontend Handbook. A comprehensive guide covering modern frontend development best practices, tools, and workflows.

Websites

MDN Docs. The go-to resource for official documentation on HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Frontend Masters. High-quality video courses taught by industry experts on frontend and full-stack development.

Code.org. A beginner-friendly platform offering interactive coding lessons and activities for learning programming fundamentals.

Magazines

The Internet Review. A publication exploring trends, ethics, and innovations in web development and the internet.

ShiftMag. A web development magazine featuring deep dives into frontend technologies, design, and best practices.

Smashing Magazine. A leading online magazine with articles, tutorials, and insights on web design and development.

Blogs

Frontend Masters Blog. Articles and insights on frontend development, JavaScript, and modern web technologies.

People

Chen Hui Jing. A frontend developer and CSS expert sharing insights on web typography, layouts, and design.

Chris Coyier. The creator of CSS-Tricks and co-founder of CodePen, sharing expertise on web design and development.

Chris Ferdinandi. A web developer advocating for simplicity, vanilla JavaScript, and practical frontend techniques.

Sara Joy. A frontend developer and designer exploring accessibility, UI/UX, and modern web development.

Tools

  • Many Tools. A collection of tools to automate the repetitive jobs involved in web development.
